intro: Dendrobium bursigerum, commonly known as the Bursaria orchid, is an epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features a sympodial growth habit with multiple pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers with white and yellow markings. Its leaves are long, narrow, and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining potting media for optimal growth.
